efe92tcMlzUTGImD1J8hhA.text: Very nice and easy to rate.  Just finished my lunch here and as I'm waiting for the check, this review writes itself.The Flat Iron steak is very good. Cooked to a nice med rare.  Not too big, just the right portion size for a quick lunch.  Good value for money. Sauces - very good to excellent.  I had bernaise and peppercorn sauces and loved them both.  If you are a sauce aficionado, order more than one of each.Burger - usually a daily special.  Very beefy and flavorful.  They cook it either med rare or well done (nothing in between).  Order it med rare or it is too dry.Side salads - comes with the flat iron steak.  They use coarsely ground dijon mustard vinaigrette and it tastes great.Eggplant with parmigiano - another great side dish.  Properly seasoned and tasty.Fries - go great with bernaise sauce, that's why you need more than one side of sauce.Great service too!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom

ME5_-Z8wmFW_X-ZcvQ8VCQ.text: Flat Iron in Covent Garden is a prime destination for a decent steak. And if you go with the flat iron cut, this place - one of the three branches anyway - must be the unbeatable favourite in London for any budget-conscious steak enthusiast.Flat Iron opened its third branch in London. The restaurant is located seconds from Covent Garden and houses a little butchery showroom at the front. If you have been to Flat Iron before, you know what to expect: exposed brick walls, wooden tables and stools, and most importantly of course the signature mini meat cleavers. All presented in a friendly, muted, light with various kinds of mostly rock music in the background that seemed timeless, if I remember correctly - I was there for the food after all, not for the music.I immediately got a table - however, if you are a group of more than four, I guess you will most likely have to wait. Just like the other two Flat Iron branches, I predict that this one will also be notoriously busy. My dinner started with a slight disappointment. The lovely waitress explained entertainingly which meats they have as specials today by showing where the cuts are from on herself. Definitely more captivating than simply pointing to the cut on the back of the menu. Unfortunately, by the time I placed my order, they had run out of the cut I wanted to try. One other option sounded a bit rustic, and the third was too large for me. So I setteld with the signature flat iron steak. Not a bad choice by any means, but I would have liked to try something different this time.I spontaneously decided to go for a red wine and after I asked for a non-oaky recommendation, I ended up ordering the Brambley French Malbec. The wine had a deep, red colour, strong and heavy, with a bit of fruit. Usually, this is exactly not the kind of wine I order, but for a medium-rare steak, this sounded like a good match. Overall, I did enjoy the wine, but next time I might go for one of the lighter white options instead. The second set back followed when I noticed that they did not provide popcorn at this branch. Well, maybe they do, and I was just unlucky, but after I got used to the tasty popcorn at the other branches, I had the feeling that I was missing out on something.All the hiccups were quickly forgotten when the beautiful plate of slate and wood arrived with the elegantly presented, sliced steak. It looked bigger than I remembered, but it could well be exactly the same size as at the other two restaurants.They have definitely perfected the flat iron steak over the years and without a question, you will struggle to match this quality and taste for a similar price in London. The steak is perfectly cooked, medium-rare, with a pleasant beef flavour and a tender, buttery texture that melts in the mouth. This steak is as good as a flat iron steak can get.The side salad that comes with the steak is okay, which is perhaps the highest praise I will ever give to any salad. I had chosen to get some fries together with my steak. Fries are supposed to be salty, so I cannot fault them on that. The little fried potato strips are as accomplished as the steak. They are a golden, crunchy delight. I would almost go as far as to advise you to go there only for the fries, really.The charmingly quirky pepper mill on the table made my dinner just a little bit more fun. And for me, steak and fries can always benefit from a dose of freshly ground black pepper corns.Motivated by a little history about one of the first ice cream makers in London with a shop in Covent Garden, Carlo Gatti, Flat Iron offers a complementary salted caramel ice cream with Dominican chocolate shavings. Salted-caramel-everything slowly becomes boring at a time when it seems more difficult to find a dessert without salted caramel, than with it. Accordingly, the highlight of the small ice cream dessert were clearly the strongly flavoured, delicate chocolate shavings.All in all, Flat Iron in Covent Garden is an outstanding steak restaurant with friendly service, where you will most likely get the best value for your money anywhere in London - if not the world - when it comes to their signature flat iron steak. A  full dinner with a glass of wine, a salad, a steak, chips and a dessert comes in for as much as you usually pay just for a high-quality steak. That alone is an achievement.

VrSRJ6q4XCLxScba1Gn_Pw.text: Another branch of the consistent brand of Flat Iron. Simplicity comes in the form ofFlat iron steaks and here is no different.Aubergine, fries, creamed spinach with Fred's sauce. All brilliant. Not withstanding the flat iron which was cooked to medium rare perfection.The new addition was a dessert of Salted caramel ice cream, with fresh shavings of chocolate, only available here. Really good! Thanks Flat Iron for a good job on the meal and a great new space in Covent Garden.

ro6AWXeudmDsr1s_wenydg.text: Simple menu, great idea! Popcorn appetizer with a full bar. They only had the flat iron cut that night but it was delicious. We loved the peppercorn and horseradish sauce. Yummy side dishes and ice cream in the end.

3PsHkjJIaKNKHiQyjj37FQ.text: They gave us a table on a Sunday evening within 30 mins without a reservation. They had delicious, complimentary, beef-dripping, popcorn for the table. Our waiter was slow. The steak was perfectly cooked however after asking for peppercorn sauce- it never came. We also got free, salted-caramel ice cream dipped in chocolate which was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. Flat Iron Steak- Medium Rare.

RQnLuQkRC9AQ8mn_A94Y5A.text: I've always been a longtime lurker on Yelp and never a reviewer but Flat Iron made me change all that. I came in on a not so busy Monday night because this place had good reviews. I ordered a flat iron steak and beer and, in turn, received a mediocre steak and the worst service. Waiter literally slammed my beer on the table and steak was poor quality for the price.  I literally had to chase down the waiter to pay the bill when I should just walked out. He paid no attention to me, was standing around talking to his coworkers and offered the worst service possible. Avoid this place at all costs.

O-1vt0hGz0fyClbt9yasdQ.text: We had such a great time here and the waiter was fantastic! Food was excellent especially for the price and my husband and I loved the atmosphere!!

ZO_b-TBz3GtKLx8YpzsaYg.text: Great server John, i think I had the name right, and steak.    Ice scream closed it out nicely.  All family members luv it !

_z3Wu9jLSvJG0Cr8mM5hUA.text: Terrific concept with good execution - I can see why they've managed to expand rather quickly and keep up the high standards.The basic £10 flat iron steak is really excellent - usually I'll order one flat iron and another special to share between two and the flat iron is as good or better than the more expensive cuts.Fries are crisp and excellent, and love the free popcorn and ice-cream.  Great room as well - I imagine we'll be seeing a lot more of these around.

v0pIW1H-bZTG8Sm7N4BFAw.text: The meal was okay. Steak was tender, cabbage was flavorful, salad was so-so.  I would have recommended this restaurant, had it not happened that  four people in our party of seven, saw mice running around. I do not do critters! And when we told the wait staff, their nonchalance was a huge concern. Definitely zero stars!

Pa5YSaEAZfk87r9AUVEuwg.text: This place is GREAT! Come and order the steak or burger either way it will be cooked to exactly how you like it. The drinks are refreshing, the sides are pretty tasty. All and all I would recommend it if you are in this area!

YUtENtkPEotM5BHGfbhxUA.text: Easy going atmosphere and quite practical after a night at the musicals. Quite loud due to party young people. Uncomplicated menu (you just choose how you want your steak, which sides and saice). The food is tasty.Although there are no desserts or coffee, you get an ice cream on your leave.Staff not surprisingly attentive... toilets completely disgusting... clearly no cleaning during the whole night!Try it!

omIhU47hCmfdyuFt-iPjCA.text: Fabulous ambience, great presentation of food, incredible steaks, tasty sauces, good service, and complimentary delicious salted caramel ice cream. The fries were out of this world, too.

n27KNvTZ0lbHKjnVq2n6fg.text: Flavorful, succulent, and affordable. The meat is cooked perfectly, and for £10 with a salad it is priced so well you can get 2 orders and not feel like a pig. They expect people to do this, so they will 'rush' an order when you're half way done if you want; it will be to your table as you're finishing the last bite of the first one. They have various cuts available, but I'd stick with the flat iron steak. I had two and was stuffed. Their salad dressing is pretty good, too -- Italian with a touch of mustard flavor. My girlfriend got the the hamburger with bernaise sauce.... Mmmm tasty. The fries were about the best I've ever had and I heard they drip steak juice all over them, which would explain their mouth watering flavor.The service was good and the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The ambience is like a cross between a local pub and a steakhouse, and they serve you a complimentary ice cream cone when you're done. They had salted caramel ice cream topped with bitter sweet chocolate shavings for a nice sweet treat to top off the scrumptious dinner. I'm visiting from the US and we have nothing like this place there. I'd recommend this for anyone that wants a juicy, flavorful steak that happens to be derived from their very own farm ( which apparently is where their meat is from, which explains why it is so affordable). 5 stars all around... Better that Ruth's Chris for a quarter the price and twice the portion.

uFZ2Me3t44w33Mf8spFBsg.text: Last time We were in London, 17 years ago, finding good food without paying an arm and a leg was challenging so finding this place was a very pleasant surprise.  Actually, local friends recommended this pace for our dinner together.  We had ordered a mix of meats and sides amongst the 7 of us.  All were very good.  Meats were tender and the sides were "scrummy."  Need to try the spinach, not the heavy creamed American version.

2qxamv8vrm6KL-u-Ba-aOw.text: Priceless delicious English steak! 10 - Flat Iron Steak Medium Rare3 - Creamed Spinach1 - Fresh Horseradish5.5 - White Wine Fresh Spanish Macabeo

gKa2wZpgKwTzugUQGhBxbg.text: Very good price point. Simple menu. Perfectly cooked steaks. Tasty sides. Craft cocktails. Free ice cream. FANTASTIC staff. Came back a second time for drink just to laugh with the bartenders. Great place.

pECLGlxdMFRBtnMSydL1XQ.text: Can't go wrong with their classic flat iron steak, medium rare. The side salad in a cup that comes with it is decently sized, but if you're hungry I'd suggest getting some chips or another side. The free caramel ice cream rolled in chocolate as you leave was a welcome and delicious surprise. Oh - and my buddy said the Old Fashioned might be the best he'd ever had. Highly recommended!

I4YbB5fDWtsTYWPUKp9p1w.text: Great tasting flat iron steak and choose the peppercorn dressing vs the Bernaisse dressing.  Fries/chips were good.  Bellini was very bitter but the Collins was good

nWENXfi_kNbGdBoZue_uOQ.text: We loved the concept of this restaurant. They have one thing on the menu, their blade steak and they do it very well. This steak comes with some mixed greens and you can order from a list of sides. We went with the fries and the eggplant. They also have changing specials, there was a burger and another type of steak, I believe, the day we went, but we came for their speciality and we were not disappointed. After waiting for over an hour for a seat at this very popular restaurant, which doesn't take reservations by the way, we were finally seated and got water and complimentary popcorn while we looked over the menu. The steak itself is tender, was cooked a perfect medium rare and was seasoned beautifully. There are a number of sauces to choose for your steak, we opted for Fred's special sauce and the béarnaise. Both were delicious and paired well with the steaks. The fries were crisp and seasoned, the eggplant was a huge winner. The layers of eggplant, cheese and a beautiful tomato sauce were heavenly and had the steak not been as good, I would have eaten this as a main dish. The steak with the greens was a measly £10 which is awesome considering the expensive downtown location. The sauces were £1 each and the sides were £3.50 I believe. At about £15 each we were quite happy with our meal and would recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes a good steak. Another highlight of this meal was the free ice cream you get at the end. With your receipt comes a token which you bring to the front and exchange for a caramel ice cream, dipped in dark chocolate shavings in a fresh waffle cone. It was a fantastic way to finish our meal.The ambiance is really cool and cozy and the service was great. The restaurant is beautiful, albeit small but it adds to the intimate environment. At about £15 each we were quite happy with our meal and would recommend this restaurant to anyone who likes a good steak in a cool environment.

4OFKUMASGEBmHDacVjUUcA.text: The restaurant is quite big and considering everyone is having the same thing you don't think it should be an hour wait. The price is good for what you get so that is probably why people are willing to wait. Free popcorn and ice cream does make it worth the wait.

QCUYw72R-nwWOIfv6HPFqA.text: The peppercorn steak sauce was delicious and packed with a hint of spiciness. The chocolate ice cream with shaved chocolate was a awesome unique experience. in general this is a to thumbs up place.

GU-Ii_FQvCNWUYlwYLuhGg.text: I know what you're thinking- on main dish on the menu? What is this? Well, this is one of those places where the chef got something right and didn't fuss with it!A quality steak at 10£ with things like chips etc on the side. That's it. There were specials like a larger steak and one really large steak to share on the chalk board. We stuck with what they obviously know.Steak was very tender. Broccoli and asparagus cooked perfectly and the chips (fries in our country) were good enough to order seconds. As if that wasn't enough, we were given a free token for a ice cream at check out. We got the Carmel dark chocolate cone they offered because it would be rude to say no. The chocolate was a bit dark for me but if you like 72% cacao, you're going to love it!The servers were also cheerful and knowledgeable! Our was was 45 minutes, as advertised when we walked in. No worries, just enough time for a drink with the young crowd and a preview of the menu.Lovely evening! Thanks Flat Iron!

r5uOYRtU8145TcvXXPJC7w.text: Great steak! Very juicy and I loved how they serve it. Very good service. Our waiter was super nice and explained everything. Loved the fresh market greens! Definitely a place to come back too.

4w2O1CF-wB6RkV1qXX_Ogg.text: Happened to stumble upon this gem while walking around Covent Garden! Was quoted a 30 minute so stepped in for a drink at the bar and enjoyed the blood orange old fashioned. Enjoyed the twist on a classic cocktail. On to the important part:- Food: flat iron steak - 10£ was a steal. It came out a perfect medium-rare. Sides - creamed spinach and chips. Everything was fantastic, perhaps a little heavy though. - Service: Really friendly server Ollie who had some great recs! Try the peppercorn sauce. - Decor: Big fan of the atmosphere that wasn't too loud and enjoyed reading the signs about the beef we were eating. Maybe too much info though haha. Overall would definitely recommend going to! Try to hit it at an off-time although you'll likely still have a wait. Budget a couple hours and enjoy! P.S. Don't forget to snag the complimentary ice cream on the way out

ZsrFReYduqWz4o0ktjCKBg.text: We happened upon this place while walking through London and I must say for a "cheap steak" it was delicious!! First you get free popcorn!! Next this delicious steak served with salad and a side and to top it off on your way out they give you a free ice cream cone.

ufIjttbkg2t9bfP0y6ZvZw.text: We got there on a saturday just past lunchtime with a party of four and expected a queue. Incredibly we were immediately allocated a nice table and given enamel mugs filled with pop corn to munch on while we perused the (very short) menu. Basically it's steak, a couple of specials (also beef related) on the board + a few sauces and sides. That's it. Find whatever it is that you do well and stick to it. :)We skipped cocktails and started with beers; my Beaverton IPA was ridiculously good: fruity and smooth. The wine we ordered afterwards was so good the table went through three bottles - sadly the name was forgotten, though it is hardly surprising after all that booze.For a tenner you get a reasonably sized piece of beautifully cooked cow. They do recommend it medium rare and it's your best bet as long as you don't mind a bit of blood. Amazing quality meat is often destroyed by overcooking;  not here. The side salad is just a bunch of somewhat limp leaves and doesn't do it for me, so I barely touched it. If you need greens with your meat + carbs I'd suggest ordering another salad from the sides menu. For our sides we ordered the chips because: beef dripping! Best fries, done the best way: crunchy outside, fluffy inside. Yes. :) My choice of sauce was bearnaise and it was on point, matching the buttery texture of  the beef so well. One order of creamed spinach never materialized, though, but later showed up on the bill - it was promptly removed after we mentioned.Service is friendly and attentive; they do hover a bit, but maybe it was because of where we were seated. As a final treat, since they don't mooch about with dessert menus, after you settle the bill you are given a token for a free ice cream on your way out. That ensures people will not sit there idly when there's salted caramel ice cream (with chocolate shavings + a good quality cone, it needs to be mentioned) to be had. Customer leaves happy = tables quickly vacated = next customers also happy. ;)

M5LmML804C1cbraTQxb1IA.text: Last May, I visited Flat Iron's second restaurant on Denmark street just outside Soho.  I've just tried out their third, and largest yet restaurant in the heart of Covent Garden - proving once again that London's desire for beef has not waned.The Covent Garden restaurant features a glass-fronted butchery room that shows off the beef as you enter.  Downstairs there is a working on-site microbrewery and just inside the front door you'll find and old-time ice cream counter.  And it's worth noting: they give you an salted-caramel ice cream for free when you're on your way out!The menu is still anchored by the £10 flat iron steak - it's juicy, rich, flavorful and tender if you don't ruin it by ordering anything above medium-rare.  But, what I saw on my last visit is that Flat Iron is getting into daily specials that go up on the blackboard as the evening wears on.  We enjoyed a £12 flank steak, shown here, in addition to a flat iron.  They also were rotating through some other cuts on the chalkboard as we ate.  I saw a little sirloin cut and chateaubriand being written up there after all the flank steaks were polished off by the hungry horde.As ever, the resident special is the béarnaise-smothered burger, but you'll only hear this from the wait-staff - it won't appear on that new specials board. The burger is served on a toasted sesame seed bun with some diced onions.  That's it - direct and to the point.  You can get a variety of hipster-sounding dips to spice it up a bit, but I like it as it is.  The ground beef is up to the standard of Flat Iron's steaks - a bit lean for a burger - but delicious nonetheless.Next up, I'll have to try out their newest location in Shoreditch! But for now, you can check out my full review: beeffanatic.com/2016/06/…

HTppNzxFlHHpX4-OpFCA1A.text: Stayed in London for 5 days on a food destination tour of sorts, going to some of the highest rated spots in London and north of the river. This was our favorite place of all. Excellent steak for an amazing price, simple menu and good cocktails. Long wait, but a nearby hotel recommended by the wait staff held us over for the hour wait. Will certainly be coming back when back in London

K2HsppkVVdKZRTCZax7dvA.text: Popped in here for drinks and loved the ambience. The drinks were tasty but a bit weak. However, the vibe and friendly staff made up for it.They give you salted caramel ice cream cone dipped in freshly shaved chocolate as a complementary dessert if you eat there.Will come back and try the food!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom

jiBKPYFBq8IyJnn5SIEX8w.text: Just have it today and it's truly brilliant. We ordered normal £10 steak, medium-rare with a spinach. They use very good material and cook it well (even though smell of butter is quite strong). And It's really affordable. Not only steak we got, after the bill they also offered an ice-cream which was very tasty. Extremely valuable for this meal.

bJVBQftLnVcoaVbOUChj8A.text: I'd heard so much about this restaurant before coming, and it certainly didn't disappoint!We came on a Friday eve so I was expecting a hefty wait, but we only had to sit at the bar for 15 minutes before getting a table. The restaurant is a lot bigger than it looks from the outside!We both ordered the 'Flat Iron Steak', it was beautifully cooked and definitely lives up to the hype. We shared sides - chips, aubergine and creamed spinach. The bearnaise sauce was a little tangy and not to my liking so I'd probably get peppercorn next time, although the creamed spinach acted as a nice sauce!  I was recommended the Plum & Apreol Spritz by the barman, it was very moreish and I'll definitely be getting it again next time.The free salted caramel ice cream at the end of the meal is a very nice touch. Although it was busy I didn't feel rushed or pressured to pay immediately after finishing our food, which can often be the case in places like this. We were able to eat our ice cream at the table and had a bit of time for our food to go down before leaving, which was nice.All in all a great place to come for a quick, cheap dinner.

hSVSojnifI792NdfYy1N1w.text: Nice little restaurant.  Steak was very good.  Service was awesome.  If you are a single, don't be scared away by the line.  Go in, give them your name, and grab a drink.  It doesn't take long at all.  Best of all there's free ice cream at the end.

TktbQ_E5y9C-0jnHtdeKvw.text: We arrived at 6:30 on a Sunday and was told about an hour wait, after about 15 min a table opened and we went downstairs. So adorable! We ordered almost every side and had the flat iron and everything was incredible. From the popcorn to the free ice cream as we left. This place is a little treasure in a big city. Very welcoming and kitschy. FYI if you don't eat steak , there really is no other option. Don't think you can get fish or chicken here. What they do, they do right!

Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom

sWRsmMnMBAx_PbGBRvXp-g.text: For my first ever review as a londoner, I really got to back up these first 4 reviews ! It s a five star all the way for Flat Iron. Wait, you're saying that just because I'm a meatlover makes me unable to judge objectively ? Yes, there's the meat, but there's also the idea & the attention to details, and that's where Flat Iron seduces.The idea - as simple as offering a great flat-iron style steak for a tenner. For this price, you'd expect the meat to be OK, but trust me, this was much more than just a standard OK.The details - first, this branch (their third in total) looks amazing from the outside as well as the inside. We've landed here by chance, looking for a cheap restaurant in the area (good luck) and well, we found this fancy-looking steakhouse.Thumbs up for : - the butcher room, where a cool dude cuts fresh meat on the spot.- the huge block of ice on the bar : it's pure compressed water, with no single bubble, which makes it last 48 hours !- the token, given to you at the end of the meal, to enjoy a great free ice-cream. Boom.- the team, very pro and enthusiastic ! Heads up to Paolo, one of the cool italian dudes, and Lucky, the ice-cream lady.The place is full every single day, but it's clearly worth the wait. A lovely dinner and global experience for 30 pounds, that's decent right ?

BlfovWzpTD-XyD_HHzNPuQ.text: The Soho Flat Iron was recommended to me by a fellow Yelper, but when I heard that there was normally a two hour wait for a table I was ready to delete it from my bookmarksWe were immediately seated. A server explained the menu and the specials and we ordered. The food and drinks came out quickly. Everything was well prepared and fresh. I ordered the flat iron for 10 £, and the dripping cooked chips. The dripping chips were amazing. They're french fries with steak drippings (i.e. the delicious fatty part) drizzled on. Like everyone else said, the steak was cooked perfectly, seasoned well, and a decent cut. The only issue I had was with the "salad" that came with the steak, which was mixed greens in a cup with dressing. I ate all of it though, because I can't just be eating beef and potatoes can I? I also had the lime/mint house fizzy, which was basically a non-alcoholic mojito and delicious. I can only imagine how good the other options were. After eating, we were given after dinner ice cream. It was pretty good, and a nice touch on a relatively cheap meal.

NUs76W1BLm3VE5Vdb1iz4w.text: Really good value food - the steaks are magnificent and the burgers at £10 are great value for money and massive! The sides are great, friendly staff and good ambience! Worth the wait for a table!

hqFy7Qd4vhGj8NYhecJ3NQ.text: We waited more than a hour to be seated and it was worth waiting . I got the flat iron meat. The meat was juicy, tender, well seasoned . Best meat ever . My husband ordered the burger and the meat . We shared the burger and hands down best burger I had from the bun till the meat and the sauce . The meat was delicious . The salad is so fresh and the fries were delicious. On our way out, we had the free ice cream . The flavor was bizarre couldn't tell if salty or sugary but it was yummiiii first time i finish an ice cream . I am not an ice cream fan. I wish I can give 6 stars to flat iron . Best food, best ambiance and especially great service and nice servers .

DifAVtTOScGjig6cV400JQ.text: Went to the Covent Garden location on a Wednesday night.  We were initially told our wait would be 90 minutes for a group of 4!  Whoa - no thanks!  But we decided to just grab a drink and chill.  So glad we did!  The wait ended up only being about 30-40 minutes and the cocktails were delicious!  Not sure why they do the ice block, as it seems to just waste a lot of time and the bartenders really struggle with it, but oh well...We decided on the 2 steak specials with a side of every sauce they offer.  The Chateaubriand steak was out of this world!  It literally just melted in your mouth and was actually cooked properly [medium rare]!  I wasn't in love with all of the sauces, but to each his own and it's fun to try them all.  Portions were generous, service was ok [waiter never refilled our drinks - um, more wine please!]. Overall,  great spot.  I'd definitely go back!  Cool atmosphere in a great spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. Chateaubriand with ALL the sauces
Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom

pzPA-qcXAdfak-ZYHYPUJg.text: Shoulder meat is incredible, do not get fooled by the size it's very filling! The wait here is a little long, I'd recommend making a reservation first, but given the price and what you get the wait it's totally worth it. The New Zealand white wine is pretty good and I would recommend this place to any traveler or just anyone on a budget and wants a good ol' time. Will come here a second time to try the burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. So full, check please!

cbGxPoI3v-HuRU6OCWI5Lg.text: What a great find! It's worth the wait. They don't take reservations so you need to put your name in at the front. We had a 2 1/2 hour wait at 7:00pm. We explored the area and looped back a couple times to check. The food was delivered fast, maybe 10 minutes tops. The steak was delicious and tender. The salad was served in a cup and was also fresh and tasty. We added the creamed spinach, also very good.

fKhkztUcAoiJqKKJRCuePA.text: Be prepared to wait but it's well worth it. The best, tender and delicious steak!!!!  The prices are great, the staff is friendly and FREE dessert!!  The atmosphere was fantastic.  The food all around is terrific no complaints at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. Delicious food, great location and awesome staff!

ocG2-iQTrMHDNA1VOGLL3A.text: I come from food city, Portland Oregon and I'm telling you that this is a total hit!  Awesome food, simple menu, cooked perfectly, priced right, fun atmosphere, good turnover and great service.... Done!

UsvbvJAlzyF5W9iLht7Cbw.text: We went to Flat Iron Covent Garden last night (14th December) for our annual Christmas meal and had an amazing time. It's our third year in a row and last nights was the best yet. There can be a little bit of a wait as it's so popular and they don't have many tables for groups but it's always well worth it and the great barman making fantastic Old Fashions means that the time flies by. The waiter was great fun, manager friendly, food amazing, perfect minimal menu with just one type of excellent steak so no long debates about over-priced Chateaubriand. I've been to a lot of steak restaurants in London and this is by far my favourite. Even the creamed spinach is amazing and the free ice cream, served with a smile, rounds the meal off perfectly.I'd wanted to go to Flat Iron for ages but was a bit put off by the queues at their smaller branches so was so happy when the big Covent Garden one opened. I've been here both with groups and as a couple and both experiences are excellent. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Hb8mENJpvvyFQvdUpuoaPg.text: We stumbled upon this place in Covent Garden and am SO glad that we did. It is a tremendous find and really the best lunch experience we had in London - very reasonably priced, awesome customer service and a unique dining experience. Loved seeing the butcher working in the window, loved the popcorn to start, the flat iron steak was delicious, the salted caramel ice cream scooped on your way out was the perfect finish. They were very cool with our kids - my son ordered the burger, which was massive and decadent (probably would order without the béarnaise sauce for kids' next time but loved it myself). Overall, it was very efficient and ran just like a well-oiled machine.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. Free salted caramel ice cream topped with chocolate to go!
Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. Specials board
Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. Flat iron steak

jVOBBqNyjamSvvpeTUNxhA.text: Flat Iron still knows the way to my heart! This latest outpost in Covent Garden is brighter and more spacious than their others, but the menu is the same - flat iron steak cooked to your liking with a choice of sides. And of course, a mini meat cleaver utensil to get stuck in properly.There's still the no reservations policy and ensuing queues, so we got there early - about 6.15ish - and were seated immediately. Perhaps a liiiittle too close to our neighbours at the communal table to enjoy date night to its fullest but cosy, and coathooks were appreciated.There was a burger special available on the night but we both went for the steak, medium-rare. It was as tasty as I remembered from the other branch, beautifully pink inside and actually chopped small enough that I didn't strictly need to use my cleaver (but obvs I made some token use anyway!). The sides were much more buttery than I remembered though - it oozed from the creamed spinach, and was a strong taste in both the chips and the initial popcorn they brought out to munch. Maybe it's a tactic to make you thirstier?! If so it worked with us and our merlot, which they serve in very hipster jars poured into tumblers rather than proper wine glasses.The highlight for me was the amazingly friendly service - from the smiley front of house who enjoyed my relief that there wasn't an hour's wait, to our lovely waiter with perfect manners. I felt really well looked after. The only service tweak I'd suggest is to make sure the bar keeps up with the kitchen - both ourselves and the couple next to us got their drinks after the steaks had arrived, which wasn't the most relaxing way round.A tasty and budget-conscious choice at £22 a head which included a good amount of wine, service, extra sauce and even a dessert on the way out - yep, as you pay the bill they give you a token to redeem by the door for a salted caramel ice cream cone. Definitely ensures you'll leave with a big smile on your face :)

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. Fave bit? The cleaver obvs ;)

AELtlxtjr3jZbe85OccVuw.text: The wait was sooooo worth it!! Everything from the popcorn served to the juicy steak to the FREE ice cream at the end. The creamed spinach was deliciousssss as well! It was the perfect place to go to when visiting London. I want to go back again tonight!

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom

Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom

lMh94EodngAmE1uTTHSVJg.text: Because of Flat Iron, I could afford decent steak as a grad student, and for that I am truly grateful.£10 gets you a the signature flat iron steak, a lightly dressed side salad, and salted caramel ice cream covered in shaved Mast Brothers chocolate on your way out. You simply cannot beat that deal, especially in London. I usually added the peppercorn sauce and a side of chips and it was still very affordable. Service was always friendly -- they have some real charmers there! A gem in an otherwise touristy, overpriced neighborhood.

hqWeh0uEeGfnUcJA_6pnSg.text: We visited the flat iron during our visit in London, and it was amazing!!! They have the best customer service and food !!

UG47YzFvZaDDI7wiM6jzHA.text: What a great find in Covent Gardens. While it is a tourist area this place is not even close.  They know what they do well and it is flat iron steak. Meat was high quality and the sides were very fresh. All the food was very tasty. I love the atmosphere and they have a great bar menu. Service was prompt, personal and very relaxing. I can't say enough good things about Flat Iron. From the moment we walked in through the entire meal, it was perfect, seriously perfect. Low key and high quality at a very fair price. I only wish I could find places like this wherever I travel.

huSEUkbqYaXMIQsCku7ryw.text: I've been to this specific restaurant three times and it never failed to please. The wait staff was absolutely perfect, so friendly.

hZTlbzH7lWai-YmUg88uzg.text: Incredible experience and food! The service was great also. My husband is a huge meat eater and I'm a vegetarian yet they were still accommodating to me. He loved the flank steak and they made me aubergine (eggplant). It was delicious. Even better yet for dessert was salted caramel ice cream with dark chocolate shavings (ice cream included for free!). Highly recommend and the prices are reasonable as well.

W6XihqxxdCioKJ9lEfDWYg.text: Delicious food, beautifully crafted cocktails and attentive service. They specialize in one thing, flat iron steak and it's delicious. The day we visited they featured a hamburger and it was amazing. The drinks are nicely crafted and their collaborative wait staff is very friendly. Nice place. Our group went back another time during our trip.

mP-Lv7G7kmy2SaGcBYJDgw.text: + Great price and high quality meat. + Sauces we tried (port and horseradish) were both phenomenal+ The Malbec wine we was a great deal for the price+ Can't complain about free ice cream- Only downside was we needed to put our names down 2 hours in advance to get a table at 9PM on Friday

QOrdps-XYCtmJwgVfS5VSg.text: We were in London from Chicago for 4 nights and went here based on other Yelp reviews.  This place was our favorite meal in London.  First, the food was really simple.  If a flat iron steak is pretty much all you offer, you better do it well.  Flat Iron did it really well!  The steaks were perfect, fries were super crisp, and you get free ice cream after your meal which was awesome!  The place was laid out with cool spaces and booths, and the prices were more than reasonable for that area.  Will come back and recommend.

EAhnmdu02TPwRZKAzlXVzw.text: London - located in the Covent Garden area this is one restaurant you must try. Steaks are well priced and service excellent. Go there as soon as their doors open. By the time we were served our lunch they already had a line waiting to be seated. Sadly they don't take reservations. But turnover is fast. They start out with a bowl of popcorn. Then the steaks and sides (fries and vegetables) cooked to perfection.   Upon leaving they provide you with a homemade caramel and toffee ice cream in a cone to go. A great lunch experience at a very reasonable price. Food quality, service and value 4 stars. Check them out if you are in London.

I3L5XS43mYYe2eINhQYS5Q.text: We had a lot of fun at Flatiron.  The food was fantastic,  the service really good.  The menu is limited,  you can only order off the menu even drinks.  The number of cuts available were few the night we went..  Go there if you love steak!

7RC6pxIb6dwp0wDXSTs8Bw.text: Wow!!!!!! Great food, great drinks & amazing service. The flat iron stake was delish and the cream of spinach was a hit. A must when in London

RmxBHn5yXo4W7abhSuVbpQ.text: Nice drinks. I ordered blood orange old fashioned, it was good. My wife ordered Strawberry and basil Collins and she really loved it.

8oXYv7BjNGHmpj5eLu4ELQ.text: It's good for a steak and a simple, yet delicious lunch. The best part, however, is at the end of the meal when you grab your ice cream cone...The salted caramel ice cream rolled in the dark chocolate shavings is divine.

5A0YmWOCn3RLcKXNUlBiVg.text: Rating this establishment has been a bit of a roller coaster. I walked into the restaurant thinking, "easy 5, I love the vibe this place gives."We(a group of 3) waited half an hour for seats and got put at a table made for four. The waitress brought us a small bucket of popcorn and I was shocked at how satisfying popcorn can be when eaten out of a bucket.The thing that made me question my judgment about the place was when the waitress sat down in the fourth empty seat at our table when taking our orders. That's not necessarily bad, just a little surprising. It caught me off guard. Anyways, they only have one entree available: their flat iron steak. For sides, we got the roasted aubergine(or eggplant for you uncultured folks). The eggplant was just ok. So at this point I'm doubting my Initial hopes of this restaurant. But then the rest of our food came.The salad was pretty nice, but the steak WAS SO GOOD. It was juicy, tender, and beefy. Everything you can hope for from a steak. The sauces we got were the peppercorn, horseradish, and the Freddy's one. The peppercorn sauce was pretty good. The horseradish was ok. The Freddy's was somewhere i between those two. I wish I could've tried the Bernaise though. And here I am wanting to give this place a 5 again.We finished our meal and it took way too long for our server to get our check. So now I'm swinging back and forth unable to decide if the food was worth the service. But then something magical happened.WE GOT FREE ICE CREAM!!! Ok ok, I know what you're thinking. "It's probably just some average vanilla ice cream." I'm here to tell you no. Guys, this ice cream is a total game changer. It was buttery and a little salty, perfectly sweet. Honestly it might've been some of the best I've ever had. Like I might come here again just for more of that.Overall: service is meh, food is yum, ICE CREAM IS FREE AND DELICIOUS.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. Medium rare steak

yf0bWXKgvsu0B_vj3TSQSg.text: One of the most amazing steak houses I have ever been too. Last night in London & we decided to try out this amazing place for only 10£ which is about $13. The flat iron steak they serve comes with a side salad. They don't take reservations but we were a party of 7. They took my name and number down and told me that it will be about an hour wait. 20 minutes later, I received a call and they said a party had cancel and to head back to the restaurant; which was 5 minutes walking distance from our hotel.  They had a ribeye special that feeds up to 3 people that was 35£. We ordered that and 3 flat irons but our server told us that they sold he last ribeye so we all ordered 6 flat irons. Two orders of chips, a few drinks for only 30£ per person. Highly highly recommend if you're ever in London! I wish they had one here in the US!

QpGi23E1cktBlxNSIHu_hQ.text: I was in London for the weekend and wanted to have steak. I found this restaurant on Yelp, and there were good reviews, so I decided to come here for dinner.When I arrived here around 5:30pm, there was about a 20 minutes wait. I had two options to chose while waiting: wait inside or give them my phone number, so they could text me when a table is ready. My phone didn't work in London, so I waited inside. After 20 minutes, I was called to be seated. They gave me complimentary popcorn. There were one long table, and people would sit next to each other. A person next you is very close that you can clearly hear their conversation. The server came, explained the special menu, and the popular dish which was flat steak medium rare. I ordered the steak as recommended. There were some sauces and sides but I didn't get any.The food came in 15 minutes, and it looked good. It came with a small salad. My steak was perfectly cooked and very tender. It seasoned well and flavorful. It was well worth the price. The portion was generous. If you're starving, I recommend to order sides. Otherwise, you'll be satisfied.The service was good, and the staff was friendly.You'll get complimentary ice cream after the meal which was good! The wait can be long if you come during the busy time, but it's worth the wait. I will come back here whenever I'm in town.

9rzDqTu7lBnvHIT7WrPj_w.text: Delicious. I ordered the  £10 Flatiron steak (the most popular choice) and with the peppercorn gravy. The meal comes with a small salad, a fact I was unaware, and separately ordered another salad - tasty but unnecessary. The free ice cream at the end is superb. I loved everything about my meal including the table of the three 20-something ...boys (would be a stretch to call them "men") talking and one, speaking of an injury, "....was so painful. It was the most pain I've ever felt. This must be what it feels like to give birth." (Cue what-the-hell-are-you-shtting-me eye contact with patrons of the table. They had the grace to look uncomfortably abashed.) Highly recommend.

9M1LBtSxca6vL-0xWMq-Tg.text: A must visit especially for tourists like us! Located in a nice Covent Garden area, their steak was so delicious and has a good value for money!! We waited for 1:45 hours on Wednesday evening because we didn't make any reservation. Apparently this steak house is always busy in the evening and according to our server, the place will be totally "crazy" (super busy) on weekend evenings! Bottom line: please make a dinner reservation.We had Flat Iron steak. It came with green leaves and we ordered grilled aubergine as side dishes; they all were very delicious! My son ordered short ribs and they were so tasty! We loved every dishes we ordered!We highly recommend this place to some friends who will travel to London! And when I am back to London, I will definitely eat there again!

GpFB78jyAgvediA0MrwVZg.text: Very good deal for good price. We got steak with salad and french fries (chips) . Also free , complimentary ice cream is offered at the end. This sweet soul serves it to you!  if you visit, make sure to show her this picture and tell her she's famous haha she'll know what you're talking about!

Ny4e9Zfi6rJMik9pcP2BbA.text: Loved, loved, LOVED Flat Iron!!! The simple (but delicious) menu, delicious drinks, and efficient & friendly service made Flat Iron a favorite for our group on our trip to London. We made sure to visit twice during our week in town because we just loved it that much! Now...if only a Flat Iron could open in North Carolina...

giVTp7O0bS1aFJ3YqwxruQ.text: The food was absolutely delicious and the wait staff was great. The steak was medium and sliced thin enough so that you didn't have to cut it again. You didn't need any sauce but the peppercorn sauce did make it go from a 8 to a 10. The chips were also fried just right. Not to hard but crispy enough.

ZLba5C19G2Zqhq7oW9pE1A.text: Interesting steakhouse concept but not the best execution. They have only two kinds of meat you can order and as far as I'm aware they're always out of one of them (I've come here more than 5 times and this has happened). Their sides selection is also not very rich. All in all an OK experience but it's a place that doesn't offer variety and doesn't make want to come back very often unless you really want to get the very specific dish they can make for you.

gU6TVF247XVYhdxcyMLBmg.text: OHHH Man. I was speechless after the first bite, but now that I've had some time to let my palette recuperate I can now give a clear review on this place. Walking around London around the Piccadilly Circus you'll find 100's of varying restaurants and after a couple nights in London we got the layout down and there were some good and bad places we found. This was one of the GREAT places we found. My wife was craving some steak and greens so we searched high and low for a steak place to satisfy our cravings.We stumble on this place with great lighting and and very hip modern design. We checked the prices and for £10 you get an 8oz steak and salad which really tickled my pickle, a bang for your buck ? I'll take it any day. So the waitlist was about  1 hour and 40 minutes.. I was going to walk away, but the wifey wanted to stay saying that most places over estimate that wait time(which they did we only waited about 40 minutes) boy was I glad we stayed.So we went in and waited with some popcorn and soda while we waited they do have a bar at the front to get you a little frisky while you wait to be blessed with the best steak of your life. Then we were sat and greeted by our waiter that was very attentive and informative about the menu. We went with the strip steak sides of cream of spinach and fries, peppercorn sauce and brendise sauce. Let's start with the sides the spinach dip alone was a pinch of salt too much BUT I saved it by dipping the potato fries in them which in turn made them better. The peppercorn sauce was my favorite very light and gave the fries a nice little buddy to mingle together with on my tongue. The salad was prepared In a metal cup o think it consisted of arugula and mixed greens but that salad perfectly harmonized with the main entree.And now the final and most important part. THE STEAK. Wow like I said I took my first bite and I couldn't even speak I took another and I still could not speak. Food usually don't do this to a human being but this must've hit some synapsis in my brain that have never been touched. But this steak was an experience to remember, it melted in my mouth and I know that saying is redundant, but that how you describe this juicy tender meat. I read on the wall about some info they have on the meat you're eating that day such as how long the cow,the cows been alive, what it's been fed, what farm it came from. And I guess everything just ties into each bite I had I really didn't want it to be over I was just so taken back by the excellence that my wife and I was served. Put simply go here if you're in London. Best steak and best meal you will have as well as experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom

lZRPLvi_MfBoC7lwgSPvmg.text: My partner and I really enjoyed this place. The staff was really nice and seemed to genuinely enjoy working there. The steak was great and only needed the salt it came with to season. Drinks were surprisingly cheaper than I expected and overall great experience. Atmosphere is cozy and modern but also home-y. Not a good place for kids. Waited about 5m before getting a table for 2 at 1730.

u4jLQPrFRsuz38R_t9dyAg.text: Great environment, nice staff and excellent food, and the complimentary ice cream cone at the end is a nice touch.

13ScSv29A0bSpl9PH6fpuA.text: The location, the vibe, the service, the food.... it was the complete package. I found Flat Iron by chance by searching for restaurants near my hotel in London that were open Sunday evening. After reading a few of the reviews I decided I would head that way and I was not disappointed. This was easily one of the best steaks I've ever had, even better than the 45GBP steak I had at Jamie Oliver's Barbecoa near St Paul's Cathedral. My only complaint was that I was not able to purchase one of their signature cleavers as a souvenir as they were sold out (must be popular!). The staff was beyond accomodating & and the entire expericne was one for the books.

yhZVGEFxh4BeX7NAgm_yOw.text: Simple menu, helpful waiter, reception dude sat me right away and brought me a mug of popcorn, and Gamma Ray IPA. This is another one of those gems, that I would have never found without yelp. I love  covent Garden and this place was right off the square.First I was seated next to some yuppies from America who were trashing my man DJ, but I did not let that get to me. Lord, help the because they know no better.Regardless, I ordered the signature flat iron steak rare, although the burger looked tempting, but the waiter talked me down, and encouraged me to get the steak. I also ordered a side of horseradish sauce and chips (fries), an 8 ball rye Ipa and gamma ray pale ale.The steak was cooked in butter and seasoned in smoked salt, and served on a platter. I used my mini butcher knife to cut this bad boy, and it was the best cut I've had in a long time. The fries were crisp, and the salad was lightly seasoned. So when you come here, get the steak, you will not regret it.

Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. Steak served on a platter, loved it

4_fRSMN9XiXQSijZzZ6QVQ.text: The wait was so long! But since it was on my checklist, had to do it. Overall the price is pretty cheap for getting steak here, and the service was great too

MNtrAwrQv4tEjRbwFyujXw.text: It's the day after our first visit to Flat Iron and we are still swooning over the amazing flat iron steak..actually everything was amazing (lamb lettuce, green beans, asparagus, fries, cocktails and ice cream cones)!! But that steak... we've never tasted a steak with so much delicious flavor! We are only visiting London for 2 nights and we are actually considering going back tonight for their ribeye because that was touted as being the better cut, which they'd run out of last night!  And trust me, as a self-described foodie who enthusiastically looks forward to an abundance of dishes, for me to want to go back, and sacrifice the experience of a new place, says a lot about how much I recommend this place!

SlSvSipbRWsQS5PKS2WDEQ.text: The steak is so gooddddd. Must try. Very juicy and tender. Affordable pricing too! Need to wait for a while but just a very short while.

Ps5_ZVGxE9nu7XIIE8qcvA.text: Last night in London. The dinner of choice, Flat Iron.  Highly recommended, simple and filling.   Drinks and a bartender who sings and dances is worth the wait, highly entertaining while waiting for our table.  We will definitely come back.  London.  Thank you!

F7Tr8qHNsE0tmH1wlPgUhQ.text: This place has a queue which tells you a lot... you should go early as usually there's a 40 mins to 2 hour waits, the steak is lovely, so soft and tender! The food is divine and at the end they give free ice cream  Like I said this place can't be reserved and so get there well in advance they have a text messaging service

c6iTuWMs9M2lMnCkv34vPQ.text: I was with a group of 6 and we didn't need a reservation... seated within 30 minutes !I was pretty nervous entering a steakhouse considering my vegan lifestyle but I didn't want to intrude on my group of friend's fancy restaurant experience so I said why not, I could always grab a bite somewhere after as well. Upon telling Lucky I was vegan everyone laughed but she informed me that they had sides of steamed broccoli and cabbage that could work for me and of course I ordered 2 of each! Not only were they delicious, but they were cheap and filling as well! I spent £10 on my meal as opposed to the £50 my friends ate, we were all satisfied so thats all that matters! Lucky had good conversation and knew the menu and ingredients very well, also hooked all of us up with an extra ice cream at the end! (Ice cream is Not vegan, i gave my cones to others).Ultimately this was one of the most memorable and best dining experiences I had on my 3 week trip to the UK, and I am surprised that it was at a steakhouse. Thanks for a good time and nice memory!

YNWvon4FFTo99tgmcdNUxQ.text: Whilst visiting London we ran across 'FlatIron Steak"   restaurant. With a limited menu consisting of Flat Iron Steak, rib eye and burgers choosing an entree was easy.  The entree is served with a small salad and vegetables and chips (fries) are available as well.  Gratis popcorn is served upon arrival and theres ice cream available upon departure. Not bad for £11. This trendy restaurant is located in the Theatre District of London Covent Garden with shops and entertainment on the streets.  Suggestion: Stop by to get in queue because the wait for a table is often 1.5 -2hrs. This provides a opportunity to visit many of the shoppes and vendors throughout the area whilst waiting. The food was excellent and the service friendly/ efficient.  The ambiance was chic with upstairs and downstairs bars.  Lively and interesting.  Cheers.

_6VCd_NOEjmpznHimukxTg.text: If you're craving some steak while in London, Flat Iron is the place to go! We visited the location in the middle of Covent Garden, and as expected, it was very popular! Fortunately, we noticed a queue forming already around 5:30pm and put our name and phone number on the waiting list, since when we came back later around 6:15pm, the queue had jumped to a whopping 1.5-2 hours! Definitely recommend dropping by a bit early to ensure you snag a table before it gets too crowded - you can walk around and browse the rest of Covent Garden while you wait! Flat Iron is known for their signature flat iron steak, which comes with a small house leaf salad on the side. The menu focuses solely on this, so it makes for easy ordering (hopefully)! You can also choose to get their ribeye instead, and/or pair your steak with some of their sauce or sides. Both of us ordered the flat iron steak special and shared sides of market greens (British broccoli for that day), aubergine, and chips. The steak comes pre-sliced and was tender and tasty. I couldn't stop talking about the mini cleaver that you get to cut your meat instead of a regular steak knife - it is so adorable that apparently they had to put a note on their menu to please not steal it and that it was available for purchase for £10 if you liked it that much! The chips were crispy and delicious, and the boyfriend particularly enjoyed the roasted aubergine and the peppercorn sauce as well. The service was the only thing that missed the mark a bit - our waitress took an extremely long time to acknowledge us and take our order, and then it took a while to get her attention to give us our check at the end despite her clearing our table and confirming previously that we didn't want any more drinks. They were unfortunately out of their limited Yorkshire beer too for the day.Otherwise, the trendy ambiance and good food made for a great visit! I think we both wished that we got a bit more steak, but for £11, it wasn't a bad deal at all. There was complimentary popcorn at the beginning of the meal and (my favorite part) salt caramel ice cream with chocolate shavings for dessert! You just take your receipt up to the counter as you're leaving. It was so, so good and a fabulous way to end the meal!

ErowjYcJiJsgYChuTjHbVA.text: £11 for steak and ice cream? You can't beat that especially when it's so good.I came at 5pm on a Monday and said I was waiting to meet someone at 530pm. They were nice enough to let me sit at a table anyway because they said it will get busier and then we'd have to wait longer for a table. Great service.While waiting they give you delicious popcorn. And you can get refills if you want.During our visit they had some specials like a burger and another cut of steak. But we stuck to the flat iron. It tasted like buttered popcorn in the best way possible. I'm sure a sauce would be good too but it's not needed.We also ordered the chips and they were perfectly cooked.To top it all off, the hazelnut ice cream covered in freshly shaved chocolate was probably the best ice cream I ate in Europe and I had a lot!I also ordered a fizzy passion fruit drink which was so good but sadly so much ice for £3. I wish they had this where I live cause I could come here all the time. It may seem basic, but it's a don't miss place for me next trip.

gm7WR0rT1eORDydeJHw4OQ.text: 4.5 stars!I'm so glad that this place was recommended to me.My first thought was, "£11 for a salad and steak can't be good salad and steak..."But upon arriving at the restaurant I changed my mind.We were told the wait would be about 30 mins, but we decided to wait.We went to the downstairs bar and got:Strawberry & basil Collins, Sloe & strawberry Bellini, and bar popcorn (is this an English thing?)The drinks were VERY good which is rare for me to say. Cocktails are bottom tier of drinks for me, but i loved these!The bartender was very friendly and nice. They really put care into making their drinks.We were seated less than 10 mins later also downstairs.We ordered our steaks medium rare. One came a little more medium than rare, but both were acceptable. The steaks are seasoned well and very juicy. Use the cute machetes to cut it up.The salad comes in a little pail and was very earthy tasting with a pretty acidic dressing, but it was good.We also got crispy drippings chips batch #128 which were okay, but nothing special.The food came very quickly and our server was extremely friendly and pleasant (but also everyone else we came into contact with in London?!)He was very good about refilling waters and checking up on us.At the end of the meal, they will give you cute baby machetes in which you trade in for ice cream upstairs by the door!Toffee Ice cream was the ice cream of the day and it was served in a crispy wafer-like cone. Toffee isn't my favorite in general but the ice cream was pretty good. I did really like the cone though!So REALLY, it's steak + salad + ice cream for £11.WORTH IT.I'll definitely be returning.

zSfpncYDAiaf38RtvbItBA.text: This restaurant was likely one of the most memorable parts of our London trip. Firstly, the food is fantastic. We ordered the steak with a side of fries and broccoli. It is al carte, so be mindful you have to pay extra for sides. Regardless, it was worth it. Everything was delicious and well done. The service was quick and friendly. Our waitress sat next to us as we ordered-- something I have never experienced in the States. They gave us complimentary gelato afterwards, which was a great surprise! Finally, the ambiance is so cool. It is communal style; we were seated at a long table next to others dining--again, something I have never experienced in the states. I would highly suggest this place if you are dining in London. When we come back, we will return to Flat Iron again for dining.

PdsCiqlRAdeSzfH-Gv0iRg.text: Great steak with cheaper price, hilghy recommend when you visit London. This locations have 2 floors, and it is not that long for waiting time.

CxhemMF_hOgOtJI0yPmrqQ.text: Cherry on top of my 9 hour layover in London. The staffs were so nice warm and welcoming. Food was decent and ambiance was beautiful. Though it was rainy, I had a great experience. Will definitely check out again when in London.

8cHuIAOVIVWOcvzA5bT6eQ.text: Wow. This place is a must for meat lovers visiting London! We waited an hour for a seat w/o reservations, but it was totally worth it, especially for the price here! FOOD: For 9 pounds ($14) you get a juicy, very tender and just utterly delicious slab of flank & side salad, served on a cutting board accompanied with a very cute mini butcher knife! We also ordered the burger special that came with the same meat, but the sauce it came with was just to die for! We actually used it to dip the flank! After devouring the first flank, we actually ordered a second flank because it was that good! Some cons of this place is that they serve only one meat a day (I don't really think this is a bad thing because they make it really good!), and the sides (fries, sauce, etc) are extra and kind of pricey. They also have a ice cream station in the front, by the bar, that seems to be really popular. Again, only 1 flavor a day. AMBIANCE: This place is big. The tables are arranged pretty close to one another, so be prepared to get cozy! They have a bar upstairs/street level, as well as downstairs (no seating downstairs). Lights are dimmed and gives off a warm homey vibe. SERVICE: Everyone is really friendly and works really quickly here! Upon arrival, without reservations they will ask for you number so they can call you when there is a table ready, but we didn't have a UK number so we got a buzzer instead! Verdict: I highly recommend this place if you are visiting London! It's a cheaper alternative for fancy restaurants that serve similar meat (with casual environment of course) !

5wcv9D99nwe_dDAAys6d5w.text: This is an awesome find! Cute little restaurant with a simple but cheap and delicious menu. Their drinks are heavenly (I recommend the Bellini) and food is high quality. My friend recommended it but said there can sometimes be a waitlist up to 3 hours because it is that good! Luckily for us we came in on a Sunday night so we only waited for about 15 minutes and were able to take a seat at the bar and enjoy a few drinks before transferring to a table. You are seated with complimentary popcorn then i ordered a steak well done with a side salad and green beans. The steak was cooked perfectly and didn't have a single part of fat in it and the green beans had a seasoning on them that made me wish they never ended. At the end of the dinner you receive a complimentary ice cream for free at a little homemade ice cream set up near the front. Icing on the cake!

_aKn-MGWNGz9Jt-HwJahUg.text: Very good place. Great attention and atmosphere, a pitty that our meat came kind of cold but I want to think that was just our case. They also give out free ice cream at the end when you leave!

3zi2vxHktberktt8TzWjWQ.text: Don't expect high-end here, but 5 stars because what they do, they do excellently; especially for the price. The steak was juicy and flavorful. The salad was nicely dressed. Service was friendly and fast. The wait was an hour but we were cell standby so we didn't to wait at the restaurant. After the meal, they give you a free small ice cream cone (sea salt caramel was the flavor) to enjoy on your walk home

fZSs3ChjctsEJ7JZ-G5haQ.text: After traveling all day and flying into London around 9pm, we were famished and looking for places to eat our first solid meal of the day and found Flat Iron to be open late. We were told that it would be a 10-15 minute wait which was fine since that would give us time to situate ourselves with the menu and have a much needed drink at the bar. The place was packed on a late Thurs evening and we were seated at one of their communal tables so there really wasn't much of a personal space. Our server was friendly and explained that for 10 pounds, their one entree consisted of a flat iron steak, and small side salad (you can order other sides like chips or veggies as an add on). She also explained that they also had late night specials for the same price but the cut of the meats were more tender and that basically it's a bang for your buck or in this case pounds. We ordered the L.C. which was part of their specials and added on chips as a side.Both our medium cooked LC steaks were nicely cooked and though the side salad was very small, for 10 pounds, I really can't complain. The meal ends with a token given to you to take to the front of the restaurant where you will receive a chocolate sea salt ice cream cone. YES. The only drawback of the meal was when we were looking at our check, we saw that a donation was already added on to the meal. The last time I checked, a donation is given voluntarily by the person donating it. We weren't even aware the restaurant was participating in any charity so that was a bit of a turn off.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom. The L.C. with chips on the side

rme_hc9kEYgqjSiuz3Rhcw.text: Was hoping to try their rib-eye but they ran out so we ordered flat iron steak.  It was delicious but make sure to order your steak medium rare as medium well is too well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Flat Iron - Covent Garden, London, United Kingdom

N1LVCuctMGNJ8qhnPz66gA.text: I traveled to London recently and stumbled into this restaurant on a Saturday night after reading reviews and I was so impressed. I figured it would be good when the host told us that it would be a three-hour wait. I was only in London for the night and I wanted good food, so I waited. I put my name on the list and explored Covent Garden - which is now my favorite little section of London. When sat down, I was given popcorn to snack on and water immediately. The menu was super simple to read and and I ordered the recommended flat iron steak with a side of fries. The price was great for what I got. I like how they also presented you with  a flat iron to chop the steak, too. It just adds to the fun experience. And, the steak was delicious! Afterward you get a token for a free ice cream on your way out. So, essentially dessert is included. I loved that part!

u5S4AMoUVfrcsQnPDWQrUQ.text: This is a great casual hipster place that was buzzing for lunch and minimal wait!  Their specialty are flat iron steaks that they purvey from a third generation cattle farmer.  Here's the beef- it was delicious !!  Pick your meat , select temperature , and then think about your sides.  We enjoyed the horseradish creme sauce and the peppercorn gravy .  I'd recommend the following sides - the fries are a must and the aubergine was something I could have eaten all day it was so delicious.  Two cocktails were noteworthy - the plum Aperol spiritz was refreshing and  the old fashioned was on point if you like whiskey libations.  *Unexpected Bonus - each of us received a cool voucher for a sea salt caramel ice cream cone rolled in shaved chocolate that was a perfect ending to our meal. Total check L 47.45 - tip included

7iy6QWaNdXE7Rha1-c6s4w.text: Simple but delicious.  Flat iron came up on a fellow foodie's IG and I'm so glad I tried it.  Wonderful atmosphere, great food, and phenomenal service. I went with the flat iron steak served with the house leaf salad, absolutely delicious.  It was a gorgeous day out so I went with the strawberry basil collins.  The drink was delicious but a bit too sweet for my liking, I would of preferred more basil flavor.  However, it was very refreshing and fit the weather of the day perfectly.I almost forgot to add, your meal comes with a salted caramel ice cream cone coated in chocolate.  Can't go wrong here.

LEx63uerMrj7Lyt4o-8O3g.text: We had to put our name in 2 and a half hours before we got seated, by boy was it worth it! I thought this would be some snooty expensive place, but to my surprise, everything was so affordable and DELICIOUS! I got the sirloin while my husband got the ribeye. They were about 8 oz each so plenty of food. We ordered side dishes of asparagus and corn, and those were amazing too. I know why there's always long lines now!

zFHzYZheBPTHQ4ZV6MDpiw.text: Absolutely one of the best restaurants EVER!!! They've got it down pact.  All is delish!!!! The service was amazing - and even though you have to wait. Soooo worth it!  TIP: Go before 6 pm and avoid the 1:30 hour wait. And if you have to wait. DO IT!!! Worth it!

eBLSb-KCk_9EjkSPzgIlbA.text: We saw this review in yelp and decided to check it out for a late lunch 2pm. It was about a 15 min wait so we sat at the bar and got a bottle of Italian Negromaro to drink at 18pounds. It was fairly easy to drink and was tasty. We then sat down and ordered, flat iron for me (11pounds), ribeye (16 pounds), for the hubs along with chips and peppercorn sauce. This also came with a nice light greens with some vinaigrette. We also got popcorn to munch on. The steaks came out medium rare which was perfect. Mine was sliced into pieces and the ribeye wasn't. We smothered the peppercorn on it. It was delicious. My flat iron wasn't as good as the ribeye and was a little chewy but that's why the diff in price. At the end of our meal they gave us this little token to redeem our ice cream rolled in chocolate flakes in a cone. This was a plus!

BHvBRigX213Ed3LCtRyZrw.text: This place was great! I would give the ambiance, food and service 5 stars. Upon arrival, we had a 30 minute wait, however you can take a walk during the wait time, because they text you when your table is ready. Once we were seated, we were greeted and served popcorn. As for drinks, I ordered the spicy red italian wine which I would recommend (it is not actually spicy). We also got the flank steak, special (cut 3 from the hindquarter), chips and spinach. The flank steak also comes with a green salad. It depends on the special, however I would recommend the flank steak. Cut 3 was a bit too beefy and chewy for my taste. We also ordered a the pepper sauce, but it was not needed. The meat is very good by itself! However, if you do order a sauce, you can certainly share it between two people. Also, make sure to take a look at the walls for the specials (I.e. Burgers or different cuts of meat). At the end of our meal, we were also given free tokens for ice cream. The ice cream was very good and the perfect finale to our great meal!

nKiKv6ZaFx3-jN9iGBf8gQ.text: This restaurant has a great vibe. Clientele is mostly young professionals. Staff is very friendly and energetic. The menu is very limited as implied by the restaurant's name. If you are looking for a flat iron steak second to none this is the place. My teenage daughter said she could eat here once a week - it was that good. The three of us shared 3 sides and were well pleased.  We were given tokens for small ice cream cones served at the front of the restaurant. A very nice touch at the end. The prices were reasonable too. I highly recommend a visit.

2C3OLDQtyek7de3YwjJZQQ.text: I would love to have had a review of this place.  We went on a Monday evening about 7:30 and there was a 90 minute wait.  So disappointing...

MozdbtU1rcSwqV7dY0sc9w.text: They do one thing, and they do it well - flat iron steak is the best here. I've never had a better £10 flat iron steak and their fries are equally delicious. The bar also serves up some of the best non-alcoholic drinks I've ever had. The best part - free salted caramel ice cream at the end of your meal. Best deal in London. I'm so glad we waited nearly an hour on a Wednesday night to get a table here. Do yourself a favor and at least try this place out. You won't regret it.

uKl4nz8JPH7DYFPkjpSF-Q.text: Awesome place for steak without breaking the bank! the ambience is great, staffs were stellar! Remember to leave some space for their free ice cream. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in London (:

EoqSb59fYltzQ577MhYwMw.text: I love how there is not much on the menu, steak or steak really. Very good quality and cheap considering it's steak. If you like steak, then it's the place to be. If you're vegetarian, you won't be able to eat much. Their cheesy spinach is great though. Best chips around as well.

xD1X6C2KKumqa9wVDg8pEQ.text: This was truly an excellent meal! The menu is so simple and the food was delicious! We had the flat iron steak with chips and the eggplant side. The steak was cooked to our liking with bernaise sauce which was amazing. The drinks were excellent as well I had a strawberry and basil fizz and my mom had Malbec wine which she raved about as well. One of the best parts is the FREE salted caramel ice cream on a cone dipped in fresh 70% cacao chocolate shavings. It was truly the icing on the cake. The prices were extremely reasonable as well. If you have to wait to be seated it is well worth your while and I would strongly recommend this to whomever is in London! I wish we lived closer so we could come back!

yeai8kfUdUV8LJYEVk14ZA.text: It is great when a restaurant/chain decides to do one thing and only thing and do it extremely well. This is flat iron - you get steak and pretty much one kind. But is beautifully tender each time. You don't get a ridiculously large portion but that is a good thing in truth. And reasonably cheap for what you get. Plus a freebie ice cream. Only one small criticism - they could be a tad more creative with the sides.

yxCdD45G8heAHrWo3a5sFA.text: Nope, not my choice. It was a chewy piece of meat, not a quality steak. Btw, they have a gimmick of choice, offering you to choose your cut, but only one option available. Nice, like Ford - you can choose any color you like for your car as longs it is black.  Flat Iron also, adds default tips into your final bill, so +12.5% to the bill without asking. If you have American Express card, it is not accepted here either. Overall experience C+. True, it is relatively cheap, but quality wise  - not even a "budget Gaucho".

hXD-TBTkQquQf0ic1WDb0A.text: Good steak and fries.   Flatiron steaks are their specialty.  Limited other menu, but big bar selection.  Trendy.  Went early and avoided the crowds.

XsRk1HVxKp9_t1mroMamag.text: To sum this place up, good quality steak at a great price. Bear in mind It is very unlikely you will spend just £10, with drink, side dishes plus service charge, you will be looking at north of £20 at least. Also it is a no book restaurant, expect to wait at least an hour at weekends.

IKo5KlDMxnioPMQnyFMmLA.text: Love this place. Surprised by its simplicity and quality. We went with the steak and salad, both with the horseradish sauce. Everything was perfect! A great find for lunch

PajlRmYzf-VSFCwFpTCZ3g.text: The best steak you can get for 10£! They'll start you off with complimentary popcorn, and specialize in flat iron steaks or featured cuts of the day. The fries/chips are equally delicious, and you can add your choice of sauce for an extra 1£ (I highly recommend the peppercorn). At the end of your meal, you get a complimentary salted caramel ice cream with fresh chocolate shavings. Doesn't get much better than free ice cream!

ZvWwyepB0hrgb7QLwYcScw.text: Had incredibly high expectations of this establishment, so much so I travelled 532 miles in a row boat across a torrent ocean putting my health at risk of potential hypothermia (never mind the numerous other devastating life threatening conditions) to be told that the ice cream machine was broken... AFTER we sat down and ordered our meal. The ice cream was the only reason I ventured a far, this is entirely unacceptable as I feel I have been taken advantage of and my trust has counted for nothing. After enquiring if they had any alternative desserts we were ushered to the door and told that we will have to come back tomorrow to pick up the "free" ice cream tokens. Unacceptable on all counts, 0/10 would not recommend a restaurant that pries on loyal customers. I hope you're happy I spent all night finishing a box of Kleenex off instead of a bowl of the creamiest most decadent churned to perfection cow produce

OEd7nKkyjAHVu1-t8RKBKQ.text: Be prepared to wait to eat as this place is popular. As they don't take bookings - turn up give your name (sometimes even queue to do this) and you'll be texted when your table is ready. When inside expect low lighting and background music subtle enough to talk over but also a busy place full of young steak lovers. The limited menu admittedly really put meOff before but they are great at what they do and obviously take pride in serving good meals. Helpful staff will explain all the beef cuts available and there is even a cow map on the back of the menu if you want to see the placement. On my last visit (as pictured) I was so desperate for their aubergine side twice over - I got it as a main meal and it really lived ip to expectations alongside a mustardy salad i wasn't keen on but also twice cooked with lots of flavour chips and creamed spinach that is rich Tasting but so moreish. All topped off with a lovely salted caramel ice cream - for free.
